result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler M. SADOWSKI

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to dismiss and read in.  The defendant plead to a similar charge in 15 CM 628.  Motion granted.
Minutes.

Petition and Order to Withdraw as Counsel of Record.
It is hereby ordered, that Ann Larson be, and hereby is allowed to withdraw as counsel of record for the defendant aboved-named. A new attorney will be appointed by the office of the State Public Defender.\
Cover letter.

Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 12-02-15 at 11:30 a.m.   Plea date is set for 01-15-16 at 3:10 p.m.    Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with Lahnna Godersky.   Bail furnished.   
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

RE:  Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Injunction, on or about 09/18/2015.
IA set for 11/09/2015, at 1:30 p.m.
